hanzi-su-wiki:
凍

Значения

Замерзать; коченеть

Мнемоника

В Китае утром, когда солнце встаёт на востоке 東, даже летом бывают заморозки и появляется лёд 冫.

Варианты

冻
purpleculture_pinyin:
dòng
to freeze; to feel very cold; aspic or jelly
заморозить; чувствовать себя очень холодно; холодец или кисель

凍土 [ dòng tǔ ]: frozen earth; permafrost; tundra

heisig_chinese_memo: Eastern Siberia is often frozen by ice so it's like a big freezer.
heisig_constituent: frozen, ice, east, tree, wood, sun, day
heisig_story: The whole secret to breaking the ice with the East is to peek behind those mysteriously "frozen smiles."
koohiiStory1: Eastern Siberia is often frozen by ice. According to wikipedia, Yakutia (in Eastern Siberia) holds the record as the coldest town on Earth. Check it out yourself...it made it stick for me!
koohiiStory2: The ice will stay frozen until the sun is visible through the trees.
kunYomi: こお.る、こご.える、こご.る、い.てる、し.みる
jp_example_words:
凍る(こおる): freeze, be frozen over, congeal
凍える(こごえる): freeze, be chilled, be frozen
冷凍(れいとう): freezing, cold storage, refrigeration
jp_readingExamples: 凍る (こお.る), 凍える (こご.える)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Ice from the east is frozen. Well, of course, all ice is frozen, but ice from the east is like, really super frozen.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine this super frozen ice from the east. You’ve never seen anything quite like it before. It’s so frozen, it’s like it was frozen once and then frozen again. Twice frozen. Feel the ice and how freezing cold it is. It’s super cold, guys.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Japan is a country in the east, and this ice was frozen in とうきょう. とうきょう is really good at freezing frozen things, so it makes sense that this frozen ice came from there.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine being in とうきょう and seeing all this frozen ice. Hear people speaking Japanese all around you as you touch and feel the freezing twice-frozen ice.
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, 冫 (лёд), 日 (день), 木 (дерево), 田 (рисовое поле)
Ru_trainchinese:
dòng: (глаг/прил) замерзать, застывать; (о человеке) мерзнуть, зябнуть; обмораживать
dòng: (сущ) желе
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the ice (冫) in the east (東) freezes
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: In the winter the ice freezes the rickshaw making it hard for people to live daily life.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "仌" to " East " sound, it means thick ice. "Shuowen": "Yeah. From the same, Dongsheng." "Zhuangzi·Geng Sangchu": "Is it a so-called freeze-thaw and ice-free person, can you stop?"

" Frozen " can mean that liquid or water-containing things are condensed by condensation. "Lu Shi Chunqiu‧ Meng Dong": "(Meng Dong's moon) the water begins to ice, the ground begins to freeze."

" Frozen " also means being frozen. "Legend of Zuo-Eighteen Years of Xianggong": "Zigeng Gate was in Chunmen, and the letter was returned under the city. Under the fish teeth, it was raining, the Chu master was cold, and the servants were few."

" Frozen " can be described as cold and cool. Song Fan Chengda "Fan Cun Wuzai": "Fengyue Wuyin is round, and quietness becomes crazy sitting."

" Frozen " can also be used to describe the crystal clear and moisturizing stone. Ming Wen Peng "Seal Collection: Stone Seals": "There are several kinds of stones, and the most important thing is the light and frozen stone."

" Frozen " can also mean the solid or semi-fluid formed by the condensed soup. Qing Pan Rongbi's "Emperor Beijing Years Jisheng‧ October‧ Shipin": "The iron horn is first fat, the soup is the beauty of the sheep. The white fish and the pig's hoof are frozen, and the fruit filling is sugar."
humanum_short_description_en: From "仌" to " East " sound, it means thick ice.
humanum_full_description:
從「仌」，「東」聲，表示厚冰。《說文》：「仌也。从仌，東聲。」《莊子‧庚桑楚》：「是乃所謂凍解冰釋者，能乎？」

　　「凍」可表示液體或含水分的東西遇冷凝結。《呂氏春秋‧孟冬》：「（孟冬之月）水始冰，地始凍。」

　　「凍」也表示受凍。《左傳‧襄公十八年》：「子庚門於純門，信於城下而還。涉於魚齒之下，甚雨及之，楚師多凍，役徒幾盡。」

　　「凍」可形容寒涼、清涼。宋范成大〈范村午坐〉：「凍樾午陰圓，靜極成癡坐。」

　　「凍」亦可形容石頭晶瑩潤澤。明文彭《印章集說‧石印》：「石有數種，燈光凍石為最。」

　　「凍」還可表示湯汁凝結成的固體或半流體。清潘榮陛《帝京歲時紀勝‧十月‧時品》：「鐵角初肥，湯羊正美。白鯗並豚蹄為凍，脂麻灌果餡為糖。」

從「 仌 」，「 東 」聲，表示厚冰。《說文》：「仌也。从仌，東聲。」《莊子‧庚桑楚》：「是乃所謂凍解冰釋者，能乎？」 「 凍 」可表示液體或含水分的東西遇冷凝結。《呂氏春秋‧孟冬》：「（孟冬之月）水始冰，地始凍。」 「 凍 」也表示受凍。《左傳‧襄公十八年》：「子庚門於純門，信於城下而還。涉於魚齒之下，甚雨及之，楚師多凍，役徒幾盡。」 「 凍 」可形容寒涼、清涼。宋范成大〈范村午坐〉：「凍樾午陰圓，靜極成癡坐。」 「 凍 」亦可形容石頭晶瑩潤澤。明文彭《印章集說‧石印》：「石有數種，燈光凍石為最。」 「 凍 」還可表示湯汁凝結成的固體或半流體。清潘榮陛《帝京歲時紀勝‧十月‧時品》：「鐵角初肥，湯羊正美。白鯗並豚蹄為凍，脂麻灌果餡為糖。」
From " 仌" to " East" sound, it means thick ice. "Shuowen": "Yeah. From the same, Dongsheng." "Zhuangzi·Geng Sangchu": "Is it a so-called freeze-thaw and ice-free person, can you stop?" " Frozen" can mean that liquid or water-containing things are condensed by condensation. "Lu Shi Chunqiu‧ Meng Dong": "(Meng Dong's moon) the water begins to ice, the ground begins to freeze." " Frozen" also means being frozen. "Legend of Zuo-Eighteen Years of Xianggong": "Zigeng Gate was in Chunmen, and the letter was returned under the city. Under the fish teeth, it was raining, the Chu master was cold, and the servants were few." " Frozen" can be described as cold and cool. Song Fan Chengda "Fan Cun Wuzai": "Fengyue Wuyin is round, and quietness becomes crazy sitting." " Frozen" can also be used to describe the crystal clear and moisturizing stone. Ming Wen Peng "Seal Collection: Stone Seals": "There are several kinds of stones, and the most important thing is the light and frozen stone." " Frozen" can also mean the solid or semi-fluid formed by the condensed soup. Qing Pan Rongbi's "Emperor Beijing Years Jisheng‧ October‧ Shipin": "The iron horn is first fat, the soup is the beauty of the sheep. The white fish and the pig's hoof are frozen, and the fruit filling is sugar."

凍字的基本解释

凍
dòng
见“冻”。

凍字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dòng］
［《廣韻》多貢切，去送，端。］
“涷2”的被通假字。“冻1”的繁体字。
(1)冰。
(2)液体或含水分的东西遇冷凝结。
(3)受冻。
(4)指暴露在外；使受冻。
(5)寒凉；清凉。参见“凍飲”、“凍樾”。
(6)汤汁凝结成的固体或半流体。
(7)形容石头晶莹润泽。亦为冻石的简称，如鸡血冻（浙江昌化石）。参见“凍石”。
(8)通“涷”。详“凍2雨”。
(9)姓。明代有冻泰。
[②]［dōng］
［《廣韻》德紅切，平東，端。］
“冻2”的繁体字。
见“凍2雨”、“凍2凍”。

凍字的康熙字典解释
凍字的源字形

小篆楷体

暂无。

freeze
Basic explanation of words
freeze
dòng
See "frozen".
freeze
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dòng］
["Guangyun" Dogon cut, go to send, end. ]
The false word for "Ji 2" was passed. The traditional characters of "冻1".
(1) Ice.
(2) Liquid or water-containing things will condense when condensed.
(3) Frozen.
(4) Means to be exposed; to freeze.
(5) Cold; cool. See "frozen drink", "frozen yue".
(6) The solid or semi-fluid formed by the condensed soup.
(7) Describe the crystal clear and moisturizing stone. Also short for frozen stone, such as chicken blood jelly (Zhejiang Changhua Stone). See "Frozen Stone".
(8) Through "flushing". Details "Frozen 2 Rain".
(9) Last name. There was frozen Thai in the Ming Dynasty.
[②]［dōng］
["Guangyun" German red cut, Pingdong, Duan. ]
The traditional characters of "冻2".
See "Freeze 2 Rain", "Freeze 2 Freeze".
freeze

Name meaning

dòng
freeze; cold, congeal; jelly
Radicals: 冫, 東  (ice, east)
Meaning Mnemonic
Ice from the east is frozen. Well, of course, all ice is frozen, but ice from the east is like, really super frozen.
Imagine this super frozen ice from the east. You’ve never seen anything quite like it before. It’s so frozen, it’s like it was frozen once and then frozen again. Twice frozen. Feel the ice and how freezing cold it is. It’s super cold, guys.
Reading Mnemonic
Japan is a country in the east, and this ice was frozen in とうきょう. とうきょう is really good at freezing frozen things, so it makes sense that this frozen ice came from there.
Imagine being in とうきょう and seeing all this frozen ice. Hear people speaking Japanese all around you as you touch and feel the freezing twice-frozen ice.
